name: sh2response
description:
Generate an appropriate response function from the image data for spherical deconvolution.

The spherical harmonic coefficients are stored according the conventions described the main documentation, which can be found at the following link: 
https://mrtrix.readthedocs.io/en/3.0.4/concepts/spherical_harmonics.html

References:
author: MRTrix3 Developers

inputs.name: SH
inputs.description: the spherical harmonic decomposition of the diffusion-weighted images

inputs.name: mask
inputs.description: the mask containing the voxels from which to estimate the response function

inputs.name: directions
inputs.description: a 4D image containing the direction vectors along which to estimate the response function

inputs.name: response
inputs.description: the output axially-symmetric spherical harmonic coefficients

inputs.name: lmax
inputs.description: specify the maximum harmonic degree of the response function to estimate

inputs.name: dump
inputs.description: dump the m=0 SH coefficients from all voxels in the mask to the output file, rather than their mean

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

output-files.name: response
output-files.description: the output axially-symmetric spherical harmonic coefficients

output-files.name: dump
output-files.description: dump the m=0 SH coefficients from all voxels in the mask to the output file, rather than their mean
